casebody.data:
Celia A. BELL, Employee
v.
GOODYEAR TIRE AND RUBBER COMPANY, Employer, Liberty Mutual Insurance Company, Carrier No. 135P17 Supreme Court of North Carolina. August 17, 2017 Matthew J. Ledwith, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, M. Duane Jones, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for Goodyear Tire And Rubber Company, et al. Kathleen G. Sumner, Attorney at Law, Greensboro, for Bell, Celia A.

ORDER

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 25th of April 2017 by Defendants for Temporary Stay:

"Motion Dissolved by order of the Court in conference, this the 17th of August 2017."

Upon consideration of the petition filed by Defendants on the 25th of April 2017 for Writ of Supersedeas of the judgment of the Court of Appeals, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 17th of August 2017."

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 25th of April 2017 by Defendants in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 17th of August 2017."

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 31st of July 2017 by Defendants to Amend Petition for Discretionary Review:

"Motion Dismissed as moot by order of the Court in conference, this the 17th of August 2017."
